DOE Job Description: Job Description Outcomes Management The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization. POSITION TITLE: Health Care Data Analyst JOB SUMMARY: This position will be responsible for coordinating efforts among quality management support staff to produce data-based work product analyzed in accordance with bio-statistical principles and methods; creating related presentations for use by hospital and medical staff leaders,and serving as an "interpreter" between Information Technology and clinical staff when it comes to problem-solving technical issues. ASSIGNMENT AREA: Outcomes Management HOURS OF WORK: Monday-Friday, 0800-1630 with requirements for flexible hours. RESPONSIBLE TO: Director Patient Safety & Quality PRE-REQUISITES : Associate degree in health care field required, preferably in Health Information Management, a clinical field or healthcare informatics. Bachelor's degree preferred. Minimum 2 years recent employment in acute health care setting. Experience in use of electronic health record (EHR). QUALIFICATIONS: Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite®; particularly Excel/QI Macros, Access and PowerPoint. Knowledge of research methodology, principles, procedures, and bio-statistical analyses. Knowledge of data management and basic coding. Ability to design, implement and maintain systems necessary to retrieve, analyze, report, and file data; skilled in graphic development and presentation. Thorough knowledge of describing data, testing hypotheses and examining relationships among variables. Proficiency in use of Excel's Analysis Tool Kit and QI Macros or equivalent statistical analysis software. Ability to generate reports from various software programs and databases, using quantitative and qualitative data in performance measurement and improvement. Ability to deliver effective written and oral reports and presentations. Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information as required. Requires planning, organizing and working on multiple tasks at one time. Requires deep concentration for a large volume of work that must be completed within a limited period of time to meet deadlines for reporting. UNIQUE PHYSICAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILIES: A. Generic Job Functions: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner B. Essential Responsibilities and Competencies: Support the organization-wide quality management, patient safety and performance improvement program through retrieval, analysis and reporting of data internally and externally in accordance with regulatory requirements and organization-wide standards. Produce reports and information as requested within established time frames. Develop and maintain competency in clinical decision support systems (including but not limited to Truven's CareDiscovery Transform and Quality Measures, Quality-Net Exchange). Identify and report variations in clinical care that require immediate follow-through. Utilize various software applications for data collection, analysis and reporting. Participate in the discussion of study design and data elements and make recommendations to fulfill the scope and objectives of the study. Coordinate and support efforts of quality management, infection control, and clinical staff to complete data collection and reports in accordance with intent (validity and reliability) and timelines. Create interactive (drop-down menu) databases to facilitate accuracy of abstractors with repetitive data entry and analysis. Analyze, report, and interpret data results, utilizing performance improvement tools and techniques such as graphs, run charts, control charts, and statistical process control in performance improvement reports to Patient Care Services, Medical Staff Departments and Administration. Apply bio-statistical analyses for physician peer review and reappointment profiling. Prepare PowerPoint slides for administrative and physician presentation to quality committees and licensing/accrediting bodies. Provide comparative data for PI teams to identify best practices; keep staff and committees aware of publicly reported data reports. Troubleshoot technical issues between Outcomes Management and liaisons to various software programs used. Resolve data conflicts and maintain integrity of databases. Function as a technical resource for others who use the same software systems and databases (e.g. Truven: CareDiscovery Quality Measures and Transform; Q-Net; Leapfrog, Excel). Function as a resource person to physicians, leadership, and staff in the analysis and interpretation of internal and external data and reports (e.g. NDNQI). Perform other duties as assigned. The Financial Analytics Section is looking for someone with a strong curiosity to explore and analyze data to inform policy decisions. If you are a critical thinker with the utmost attention to detail, the ability to conduct logical problem-solving, and the willingness to learn new skills, this may be a good fit for you. About the Division Our Data Analyst position is located in the Financial Analytics Section (FAS) within the Financial Services Division (FSD) of the Washington State Health Care Authority (HCA). To inform decision making, FAS provides data, data analysis, and relevant consultation to HCA stakeholders by leveraging knowledge of HCA programs and policies. FAS contributes critical products that are used to develop and monitor State healthcare policy and HCA’s budget, financial operations, and program rates and outcomes. About the position The Data Analyst will perform assigned tasks of a highly specialized and technical nature. The tasks will include reviewing and analyzing policy changes; determining methodologies for financial modeling; conducting data-intensive analyses; and writing reports to inform HCA’s budget, rates, forecasts, and policy discussions with external stakeholders. This position is eligible to telework part-time but is occasionally required to report on-site. Duties This position is responsible for: Providing expert advice to inform and guide HCA budget and decision packages, bill analyses, fiscal notes, forecast steps, and other ad hoc analyses requests. Establishing project data requirements and extracting data using PL/SQL Developer and Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio. Analyzing medical assistance, Public Employees Benefits Board, and School Employees Benefits Board data which are used to guide the agency’s budget request and policy decisions. Organizing and coordinating analyses in order to detect trends, correlations, or any other patterns in financial data pertinent to agency operations. Analyzing reports prepared by other state and federal agencies to evaluate their impact on, or relationship to, the HCA’s goals, objectives, and budget. Working closely with internal and external staff, including senior management and legislative staff, on projects requiring information and analysis. Collaborating with other divisions within HCA, partner agencies, and stakeholders to support the goals of Healthier Washington and efforts to introduce value-based purchasing options to Washington’s health care system. Qualifications Required Qualifications A master’s Degree in economics, statistics, or a related field. Experience within the State or other government entity is strongly preferred. OR A bachelor’s degree in economics, statistics, or a related field. AND Three (3) or more years of experience working with large and complex data is required. Experience within the State or other government entity is strongly preferred. Desired Education, Experience, and Competencies Education or experience in medical billing. Experience working within the Washington State legislature process. Knowledge of state and federal laws, rules, and regulations that govern Washington State’s publicly funded healthcare programs. Knowledge of analytical querying protocols such as SQL. Advanced level skill in using Microsoft Excel. Effective verbal, visual, and written communication skills, including the ability to translate complex analytical information for non-technical audiences. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced work environment. Ability to facilitate policy discussions between diverse groups. Supplemental Information How to Apply Only candidates who reflect the minimum qualifications on their NEOGOV profile will be considered. Failure to follow the application instructions below may lead to disqualification. To apply for this position, you will need to complete your profile and attach: A cover letter that specifically addresses how you meet the qualifications for this position. Current resume . Three professional references , including a minimum of one past supervisor. About HCA The Washington State Health Care Authority (HCA) is committed to whole-person care, integrating physical health and behavioral health services for better results and healthier residents. HCA purchases health care for more than 2.5 million Washington residents through Apple Health (Medicaid), the Public Employees Benefits Board (PEBB) Program, and the School Employees Benefits Board (SEBB) Program. As the largest health care purchaser in the state, we lead the effort to transform health care, helping ensure Washington residents have access to better health and better care at a lower cost. Reposting the position for a larger pool of applicants. First review of applications will be on March 31st. OVERVIEW This position will be part of the City’s IT team and will report directly to the IT supervisor. The IT group consists of eleven positions including the IT Manager. Support and reporting issues can be escalated to the System Analyst I, and/or the IT supervisor. This position also coordinates with the existing Functional Analyst on systems and supports. The Functional analyst(s) work consists of working with SQL databases, major City systems such as Finance and Human Resources (Central Square), Help Desk Ticketing, Contract Management, Digital Signatures, Asset Management and Work Order Management system (Cityworks) and other assigned new implementations. In addition, general reporting and support of other minor systems are commonly required. Looking ahead to next year we are preparing for two new implementations that include Capital Budgeting and Project Management and Parking Enforcement. There will also be major systems update that may involve business analysis, system testing, user training and new functionality implementation. DEFINITION This position is responsible for the effective configuration and use of the assigned City systems. This position will work with operational staff to leverage the application through process analysis, deep understanding of both the business process and the enterprise system, and configuration of the enterprise system to best meet operational needs. The position is responsible for the support and training of users of the assigned City systems and serves as the liaison between the operational staff and the IT team. EXAMPLES OF DUTIES ESSENTIAL AND MARGINAL FUNCTION STATEMENTS Essential and other important responsibilities and duties may include, but are not limited to, the following: Essential Functions : Serve as steward of the assigned City systems by collecting and maintaining information, assessing the alignment of the application with current and future IT and business needs. Serve as Tier 1 TSQL reporting and support. Provide front line application support and troubleshooting to application users. Provide business analysis and requirements gathering. Work with end users, subject matter experts, and super users to understand and document business processes and requirements. Use systems best practices as a basis for collaboration with stakeholders and subject matter experts to modify system processes and implement approved changes. Serve as the primary interface between stakeholders and the Informational Technology division. Assist end users, subject matter experts, and super users in understanding how to achieve business results with the computerized tool and use the application to better meet operational objectives. Configure assigned City systems application-parameters and initial settings that influence the operation of programs, processes and operating system settings and provide documentation of the same. Analyze new functionality introduced by the application vendor and guide the implementation of functionality deemed advantageous to the City. Develop queries and reports that are ongoing and customized. Provide training on the use of assigned City systems, to individuals and small groups Study issues and determine if the issue arises out of a need for training or a need for technical solution. Recommend a course of action to resolve the issue. Conduct testing of core operational processes and applications during software upgrades. Manage and fulfill application work requests (both functional and technical). Document workflows and business processes. Evaluate user requirements. Marginal Function : Perform related duties and responsibilities as required. QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of : Finance, Human Resource, Asset Management, Work Order, Contract Routing, Digital Signature, Capital Improvement Management, Project Management and Parking Enforcement systems desired. Knowledge of enterprise applications required. Database structures, relationships and content. Process improvement and business process analysis techniques to support improved operations, decreased turnaround times, and streamline work processes. Report and query writing languages, table relationships, and views. Automated systems testing procedures, data conversion analyses, transaction processing, and application troubleshooting. Ability to : Participate and work effectively in an organization committed to advancing principles and practices of equity and anti-racism. Develop a basic understanding of the operational areas served by assigned City systems, and the basic business functions of the City served by that application within the first six months of hire. Assess business requirements as they relate to computerized systems. Teach technical topics to non-technical personnel. Create and maintain operational dashboards. Perform system administration. Provide timely customer service to internal and external customers Perform workflow development using vendor provided tools Translate business requirements into technical specifications Use email, outlook, browsers, Word, Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, Visio or other drawing tool, report writers and TSQL reporting services. Foster a climate that encourages fairness, respect, and inclusiveness. Communicate effectively and in a timely manner with individuals with different background and language skills or styles. Translate technical concepts and ideas in a non-technical fashion. Manage stakeholders with competing priorities. Utilize core conflict management techniques to resolve issues in a productive manner. Experience and Training Guidelines Any combination of experience and training that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be: Experience : 3 years as a Business or Functional Analyst including application configuration, report development and analytics, working with a transactional application and working with geographical information systems. Public sector experience preferred. Training : A 4-year college degree in geographic information systems or computer science is preferred. Any combination of related education, training and experience equivalent to the 4-year degree may be substituted for the educational requirement. SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION To demonstrate skills and interest, please complete the application and Supplemental Questions in lieu of a cover letter or a resume. (This application does not allow for attachments. Providing complete responses in the Supplemental Questions section will help us determine your qualifications for the job.) Employees Working Remotely: The City is implementing a remote work policy that will allow staff to work remotely. Remote work for this position is subject to department's operational needs and will be discussed with candidates during the selection process. Full-time remote work is not an option. Once hired, employees must reside in the State of Washington. COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement : A candidate selected and offered the job must be fully vaccinated and demonstrate proof of vaccination against Covid-19.
